a.g: Ha, Meem.
'Ayn, Seen, Qaf.
Thus has He revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and to those before you - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.

The heavens almost break from above them, and the angels exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is Allah who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿ والملائكة يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويستغفرون لمن في الأرض ﴾ {} وأخبر تعالى أن النار أعدها لإعدائه وإنما خوف بها أولياءه فقال: ﴿ لهم من فوقهم ظلل من النار ومن تحتهم ظلل ذلك يخوف الله به عباده ﴾{} وقال تعالى: ﴿ واتقوا النار التي أعدت للكافرين ﴾{} وقال تعالى: ﴿ فأنذرتكم نارا تلظى لا يصلاها إلا الأشقى الذي كذب وتولى ﴾{}
Indeed, the Most High says: "And the angels glorify [yusabbiḥūna] with the praise of their Lord and seek forgiveness for those on the earth." And the Most High informs that the Fire [al-nār] He prepared for His enemies, and He only frightens with it His allies [awliyā'], so He said: "For them, from above them are coverings of the Fire, and from beneath them are coverings. That is how Allah frightens His servants with it." And the Most High says: "And fear the Fire which has been prepared for the disbelievers [al-kāfirīn]." And the Most High says: "So I have warned you of a Fire that blazes fiercely; none shall enter it except the most wretched, who denied and turned away."

a.g: And those who take as allies other than Him - Allah is [yet] Guardian over them; and you, [O Muhammad], are not over them a manager.

And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn the Mother of Cities [Makkah] and those around it and warn of the Day of Assembly, about which there is no doubt. A party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze.
And if Allah willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills into His mercy. And the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.
Or have they taken protectors [or allies] besides him? But Allah - He is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
And in anything over which you disagree - its ruling is [to be referred] to Allah. [Say], "That is Allah, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back."

[He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أي كل ما لا قوام له بنفسه - وإنما قوامه بغيره - فهو باعتبار نفسه باطل، وإنما حقيته وحقيقته بغيره لا بنفسه، فإذن لا حق بالحقيقة إلى الحي القيوم الذي ليس كمثله شيء، فإنه قائم بذاته وكل ما سواه قائم بقدرته، فهو الحق وما سواه باطل.
Indeed, everything that has no subsistence [qiwam] by its own self—and its subsistence is only by other than itself—then, in consideration of its own self, it is false [batil]. Its reality [haqiqa] and its true nature [hqiqah] are only by other than itself, not by its own self. Therefore, there is no true reality [haqq] in truth [al-haqiqa] except for the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsisting [al-Hayy al-Qayyum], for Whom there is nothing like unto Him. For He subsists by His own Essence [dhat], and everything other than Him subsists by His power [qudrah]. Thus, He is the True Reality [al-Haqq], and everything other than Him is false [batil].

a.g: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is, of all things, Knowing.

He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are, concerning it, in disquieting doubt.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "وما تفرقوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغياً بينهم" فأنزل الله العلم ليجمعهم ويؤلف بينهم على طاعته، وأمرهم أن يتألفوا بالعلم فتحاسدوا واختلفوا إذ أراد كل واحد منهم أن ينفرد بالرياسة وقبول القول فرد بعضهم على بعض.
Indeed, God Almighty has said, "And they did not become divided except after knowledge [al-'ilm] had come to them, out of envy among themselves." Indeed, God sent down knowledge [al-'ilm] to gather them and unite them upon obedience to Him, and He commanded them to unite through knowledge [al-'ilm]. Yet they became envious and differed, for each one of them desired to be singled out for leadership [al-ri'asa] and for his word to be accepted, so they began to refute one another.

a.g: So to that [religion of Allah] invite, [O Muhammad], and remain on a right course as you are commanded and do not follow their inclinations but say, "I have believed in what Allah has revealed of the Qur'an, and I have been commanded to do justice among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you your deeds. There is no [need for] argument between us and you. Allah will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination."
And those who argue concerning Allah after He has been responded to - their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.
It is Allah who has sent down the Book in truth and [also] the balance. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.
Those who do not believe in it are impatient for it, but those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are in extreme error.
Allah is Subtle with His servants; He gives provisions to whom He wills. And He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.

Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: " من كان يريد حرث الآخرة نزد له في حرثه، ومن كان يريد حرث الدنيا نؤته منها وما له في الآخرة من نصيب ". فترك المطاعم اللذيذة طمعاً في فواكه الجنة وخوفاً من أن يقال له: " أذهبتم طيباتكم في حياتكم الدنيا" فآثر في جميع ذلك ما وعد على ما تيسر له في الدنيا عفواً صفواً لعلمه بأن ما في الآخرة خير وأبقى، وأن ما سوى هذا فمعاملات دنيوية لا جدوى لها في الآخرة أصلاً.
Indeed, "Whoever desires the harvest [ḥarth] of the Hereafter [al-Ākhira], We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest [ḥarth] of this world [al-dunyā], We give him thereof, but there is for him in the Hereafter [al-Ākhira] no share." So, he abandons the delicious foods out of longing for the fruits of Paradise [al-Jannah] and out of fear that it will be said to him: "You exhausted your good things in your worldly life." Thus, in all of that, he prefers what is promised over what is made readily available to him in this world [al-dunyā], purely and sincerely, because of his knowledge [‘ilm] that what is in the Hereafter [al-Ākhira] is better and more lasting, and that whatever is besides this is worldly [dunyawiyya] transactions that have no benefit in the Hereafter [al-Ākhira] whatsoever.

a.g: Or have they other deities who have ordained for them a religion to which Allah has not consented? But if not for the decisive word, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.

You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will [certainly] befall them. And those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in lush regions of the gardens [in Paradise] having whatever they will in the presence of their Lord. That is what is the great bounty.

It is that of which Allah gives good tidings to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for this message any payment [but] only good will through kinship." And whoever commits a good deed - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Appreciative.

Or do they say, "He has invented about Allah a lie"? But if Allah willed, He could seal over your heart. And Allah eliminates falsehood and establishes the truth by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
And it is He who accepts repentance from his servants and pardons misdeeds, and He knows what you do.
And He answers [the supplication of] those who have believed and done righteous deeds and increases [for] them from His bounty. But the disbelievers will have a severe punishment.

And if Allah had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed He is, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى: ﴿ ولو بسط الله الرزق لعباده لبغوا في الأرض ﴾ {} وقال تعالى: ﴿ كلا إن الإنسان ليطغى أن رآه استغنى ﴾ {} وقال ﭬ: (إن الله ليحمى عبده المؤمن من الدنيا وهو يحبه كما يحمى أحدكم مريضه[93]) وكذلك الزوجة والولد والقريب وكل ما ذكرناه في الأقسام الستة عشر من النعم سوى الإيمان وحسن الخلق فإنها يتصور أن تكون بلاء في حق بعض الناس فتكون أضدادها إذن نعما في حقهم إذ سبق أن المعرفة كمال ونعمة فإنها صفة من صفات الله تعالى ولكن قد تكون على العبد في بعض الأمور بلاء ويكون فقدها نعمة مثاله جهل الإنسان بأجله فإنه نعمة عليه إذ لو عرفه ربما تنغص عليه العيش وطال بذلك غمه وكذلك جهله بما يضمره الناس عليه من معارفه وأقاربه نعمة عليه إذ لو رفع الستر واطلع عليه لطال ألمه وحقده وحسده واشتغاله بالانتقام وكذلك جهله بالصفات المذمومة من غيره نعمة عليه إذ لو عرفها أبغضه وآذاه وكان ذلك وبالا عليه في الدنيا والآخرة بل جهله بالصفات المحمودة في غيره قد يكون نعمة عليه فإنه ربما يكون وليا لله تعالى وهو يضطر إلى إيذائه وإهانته ولو عرف ذلك وآذى كان إثمه لا محالة أعظم فليس من آذى نبيا أو وليا وهو يعرف كمن آذى وهو لا يعرف ومنها إبهام الله تعالى أمر القيامة وإبهامه ليلة القدر وساعة يوم الجمعة وإبهامه بعض الكبائر فكل ذلك نعمة لأن هذا الجهل يوفر دواعيك على الطلب والاجتهاد فهذه وجوه نعم الله تعالى في الجهل فكيف في العلم وحيث قلنا إن لله تعالى في كل موجود نعمة فهو حق وذلك مطرد في حق كل أحد ولا يستثنى عنه بالظن إلا الآلام التى يخلقها في بعض الناس وهى أيضا قد تكون نعمة في حق المتألم بها فإن لم تكن نعمة في حقه كالألم الحاصل من المعصية كقطعه يد نفسه ووشمه بشرته فإنه يتألم به وهو عاص به وألم الكفار في النار فهو أيضا نعمة ولكن في حق غيرهم من العباد لا في حقهم لأن مصائب قوم عند قوم فوائد ولولا أن الله تعالى خلق العذاب وعذب به طائفة لما عرف المتنعمون قدر نعمه ولو كثر فرحهم بها ففرح أهل الجنة إنما يتضاعف إذا تفكروا في آلام أهل النار أما ترى أهل الدنيا ليس يشتد فرحهم بنور الشمس مع شدة حاجتهم إليه من حيث إنها عامة مبذولة ولا يشتد فرحهم بالنظر إلى زينة السماء وهى أحسن من كل بستان لهم في الأرض يجتهدون في عمارته ولكن زينة السماء لما عمت لم يشعروا بها ولم يفرحوا بسببها فإذن قد صح ما ذكرناه من أن الله تعالى لم يخلق شيئا إلا وفيه حكمة ولا خلق شيئا إلا وفيه نعمة إما على جميع عباده أو على بعضهم فإذن في خلق الله تعالى البلاء نعمة أيضا إما على المبتلى أو على غير المبتلى فإذن كل حالة لا توصف بأنها بلاء مطلق ولا نعمة مطلقة فيجتمع فيها على العبد وظيفتان الصبر والشكر جميعاً.
Indeed, if Allah had expanded provision [ar-rizq] for His servants, they would have transgressed in the earth. And indeed, man becomes insolent when he sees himself self-sufficient. And indeed, Allah protects His believing servant from the world [ad-dunya] while He loves him, just as one of you protects his sick one. And likewise, the wife, the child, the relative, and everything we have mentioned in the sixteen categories of blessings besides faith [iman] and good character [husn al-khuluq]—it is conceivable that they become a trial [bala'] for some people, so their opposites then become blessings [ni'mah] for them. For it preceded that knowledge [ma'rifah] is a perfection and a blessing, as it is an attribute from the attributes of Allah, the Exalted. But it may be upon the servant in some matters a trial, and its absence a blessing. Its example is the ignorance [jahl] of a person concerning his appointed term [ajal]; indeed, it is a blessing for him, for if he knew it, perhaps his life would become bitter and his grief would thereby be prolonged. And likewise, his ignorance of what his acquaintances and relatives harbor against him is a blessing for him, for if the veil [as-sitr] were lifted and he became aware of it, his pain, his rancor, and his envy would be prolonged, and he would be preoccupied with revenge. And likewise, his ignorance of the blameworthy attributes in others is a blessing for him, for if he knew them, he would hate him and harm him, and that would be a calamity upon him in this world [ad-dunya] and the Hereafter [al-akhirah]. Rather, his ignorance of the praiseworthy attributes in others may be a blessing for him, for perhaps he is a friend [wali] of Allah, the Exalted, and he is compelled to harm and insult him. And if he knew that and harmed him, his sin would undoubtedly be greater. For he who harms a prophet or a friend while knowing is not like he who harms while not knowing. And from them is Allah, the Exalted, making the matter of the Resurrection ambiguous, and His making the Night of Decree ambiguous, and the hour of Friday ambiguous, and His making some of the major sins ambiguous. All of that is a blessing, because this ignorance [jahl] increases your motives for seeking and striving. These are aspects of Allah's blessings in ignorance, so how about in knowledge [al-'ilm]? And since we said that for Allah, the Exalted, in every existent thing there is a blessing, that is true. And that applies to everyone, and none is excluded from it by mere conjecture except the pains which He creates in some people. And they also may be a blessing for the one who suffers them. And if they are not a blessing for him, like the pain resulting from sin, such as him cutting his own hand or tattooing his skin, then he suffers from it while he is sinful in it. And the pain of the disbelievers in the Fire is also a blessing, but for others among the servants, not for them. For the misfortunes of one people are benefits for another people. And were it not that Allah, the Exalted, created punishment and punished a group with it, those enjoying comfort would not know the measure of His blessings, even if their joy in them increased. For the joy of the people of Paradise only multiplies when they reflect upon the pains of the people of the Fire. Do you not see the people of this world [ad-dunya]? Their joy in the light of the sun does not intensify, despite their severe need for it, because it is universal and freely given. And their joy in looking at the adornment of the sky does not intensify, though it is more beautiful than every garden they have on earth which they strive to cultivate. But because the adornment of the sky is universal, they do not perceive it and do not rejoice because of it. Therefore, what we mentioned has been confirmed: that Allah, the Exalted, did not create anything except that in it is wisdom [hikmah], and He did not create anything except that in it is a blessing [ni'mah], either for all His servants or for some of them. Therefore, in Allah's creation of the trial [al-bala'] there is also a blessing, either for the one afflicted or for other than the one afflicted. Therefore, every state cannot be described as an absolute trial nor an absolute blessing. So two duties converge upon the servant in it: patience [as-sabr] and gratitude [ash-shukr] together.

a.g: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.
And of his signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He, for gathering them when He wills, is competent.
And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
SKIPPED_NOT_FOUND
Indeed, shall I not inform you of the most hopeful verse in the Qur'an? They said, "Yes, of course." So he recited to them: **"And whatever affliction [musiba] befalls you is by what your own hands have earned, and He pardons much."** So the afflictions [masa'ib] in this lower world [dunya] are due to the earning of sins [awzar]. If Allah punishes him in this world [dunya], then Allah is more generous [akram] than to punish him a second time. And if He pardons him in this world [dunya], then Allah is more generous [akram] than to punish him on the Day of Resurrection [Yawm al-Qiyamah].

a.g: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth. And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.
If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
Or He could destroy them for what they earned; but He pardons much.
And [that is so] those who dispute concerning Our signs may know that for them there is no place of escape.
So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely
And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive,
And those who have responded to their lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأما الرتبة العليا فهي التي وصف الله تعالى المؤمنين بها في قوله وأمرهم شورى بينهم ومما رزقناهم ينفقون أي كانوا خلطاء في الأموال لا يميز بعضهم رحله عن بعض.
And as for the highest rank [al-rutbah al-'ulya], it is that which God, exalted is He, described the believers with in His saying: "And their affair is [conducted through] consultation [shura] among them, and from what We have provided them, they spend." That is, they were partners in wealth [amwal], not distinguishing some of their provisions from others.

a.g: And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves,
And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from Allah. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.
And whoever avenges himself after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].
The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "إنما السبيل على الذين يظلمون الناس ويبغون في الأرض بغير الحق" والنمام منهم.
Indeed, the path [al-sabil] is only against those who wrong the people [yazlimun al-nas] and commit aggression in the earth [yabghun fi al-ard] without right [bighayr al-haqq] — and the slanderer [al-nammam] is among them.

a.g: And whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [requiring] determination.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله ولمن صبر وغفر إن ذلك لمن عزم الأمور ولما كسرت رباعيته وشج يوم أحد فجعل الدم يسيل على وجهه وهو يمسح الدم ويقول كيف يفلح قوم خضبوا وجه نبيهم بالدم وهو يدعوهم إلى ربهم فأنزل الله تعالى ليس لك من الأمر شيء تأديبا له على ذلك وأمثال هذه التأديبات في القرآن لا تحصر وهو صلى الله عليه وسلم المقصود الأول بالتأديب والتهذيب ثم منه يشرق النور على كافة الخلق فإنه أدب بالقرآن وأدب الخلق به ولذلك قال صلى الله عليه وسلم بعثت لأتمم مكارم الأخلاق ثم رغب الخلق في محاسن الأخلاق بما أوردناه في كتاب رياضة النفس وتهذيب الأخلاق فلا نعيده ثم لما أكمل الله تعالى خلقه أثنى عليه فقال تعالى وإنك لعلى خلق عظيم فسبحانه ما أعظم شأنه وأتم امتنانه ثم انظر إلى عميم لطفه وعظيم فضله كيف أعطى ثم أثنى فهو الذي زينه بالخلق الكريم ثم أضاف إليه ذلك فقال وإنك لعلى خلق عظيم ثم بين رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم للخلق أن الله يحب مكارم الأخلاق ويبغض سفسافها
Indeed, for one who is patient [ṣabara] and forgives [ghafara]—verily, that is among the matters of firm resolve [ʿazm al-umūr]. And when his molar was broken and he was wounded on the Day of Uḥud, and the blood began to flow upon his face while he was wiping the blood away, and he said, "How can a people prosper who have stained the face of their Prophet with blood, while he calls them to their Lord?" Then God, the Exalted, revealed: "Not for you is any part of the command," as an admonishment [taʾdīb] to him for that. And the likes of these admonishments in the Qur'an are without number. And he, peace and blessings be upon him, is the first and primary intended recipient of the admonishment and refinement [tahdhīb]; then from him the light [nūr] shines upon all of creation. For he was refined by the Qur'an, and he refined creation with it. And for that reason he, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "I was sent to perfect noble character [makārim al-akhlāq]." Then he inclined creation toward the beauties of character by what We have presented in the Book of the Discipline of the Soul [riyāḍat al-nafs] and the Refinement of Character [tahdhīb al-akhlāq], so We shall not repeat it. Then when God, the Exalted, completed his creation, He praised him, saying, "And indeed, you are upon a great character [khuluq ʿaẓīm]." So glory be to Him—how magnificent is His affair and how perfect is His favor! Then look at the vastness of His gentleness [luṭf] and the greatness of His grace [faḍl]—how He gave, then He praised. For He is the One who adorned him with noble character [al-khuluq al-karīm], then attributed that to him, saying, "And indeed, you are upon a great character." Then the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, made clear to creation that God loves noble character and despises its base and trivial aspects.

a.g: And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no protector beyond Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there for return [to the former world] any way?"

And you will see them being exposed to the Fire, humbled from humiliation, looking from [behind] a covert glance. And those who had believed will say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment."
And there will not be for them any allies to aid them other than Allah. And whoever Allah sends astray - for him there is no way.
Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. No refuge will you have that day, nor for you will there be any denial.

But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.
To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what he wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.
Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

And it is not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم الواقع في القلب بغير حيلة وتعلم واجتهاد من العبد ينقسم إلى ما لا يدري العبد أنه كيف حصل له ومن أين حصل وإلى ما يطلع معه على السبب الذي منه استفاد ذلك العلم وهو مشاهدة الملك الملقى في القلب والأول يسمى إلهاما ونفثا في الروع والثاني يسمى وحيا وتختص به الأنبياء والأول يختص به الأولياء والأصفياء. فإن العلم إنما يحصل في قلوبنا بواسطة الملائكة وإليه الإشارة بقوله تعالى وما كان لبشر أن يكلمه الله إلا وحيا أو من وراء حجاب أو يرسل رسولا فيوحي بإذنه ما يشاء.
Indeed, that which occurs in the heart [qalb] without any contrivance, learning, or striving on the part of the servant divides into two kinds: that which the servant does not know how it came to him or from where it was obtained, and that which he perceives along with it the cause from which he derived that knowledge [‘ilm], which is the witnessing of the angel casting it into the heart [qalb]. The first is called inspiration [ilhām] and a whispering into the innermost self [nafth fī al-raw‘]. The second is called revelation [waḥy], and it is specific to the Prophets, while the first is specific to the saints [awliyā’] and the purified ones [aṣfiyā’]. For indeed, knowledge [‘ilm] only occurs in our hearts [qulūb] by means of the angels, and the allusion to this is in His saying, the Most High: "And it is not for any human that Allah should speak to him except by revelation [waḥy] or from behind a veil [ḥijāb] or that He sends a messenger to reveal [yūḥī], by His permission, what He wills."

a.g: And thus We have revealed to you an inspiration of Our command. You did not know what is the Book or [what is] faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Muhammad], you guide to a straight path -
The path of Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah do [all] matters evolve.
